Well, you need to set some command line arguments.  The user guide 
describes them:

http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#N1008F

Also, by default, Heritrix spits console output to a file called 
heritrix_dmesg.log.  You should check that file to see if it's 
complaining about anything.  To get the output to dump to the console, 
you can specify -Dheritrix.development in the JVM arguments when running 
Eclipse.  (To set JVM and application command-line arguments in Eclipse, 
select Run/Open Run Dialog from the pull-down menu, then click the 
"Arguments" tab.)

-Paul

mikej wrote:
> 
> 
> Thanks for the help so far, but I am hitting the following issue:
> 
> First - I confirmed that the lib jar files are visible by checking the 
> following:
> Right click on project --> select Properties --> highligh 'Java Build 
> Path' --> Select 'Libraries' tab. All jars appear to configured for the 
> environment. At one point I did have to 'Edit...' the location of the 
> jars to point to proper version of the jar. That all seems to be taken 
> care of.
> 
> 1) I opened the 'src/java' tree and then opened the 
> 'org.archive.crawler' tree
> 2) I right clicked on the 'Heritrix.java' and select 'Debug As' --> Java 
> Application
> 
> I get the following error immediately in the Eclipse Console window -
> "<terminated> Heritrix [Java Application] C:\Program 
> Files\Java\jre1.5.0_10\bin\javaw.exe (Aug 23, 2007 5:41:04 PM)"
> 
> Mike
> 
> On 8/23/07, * Paul Jack* <pjack@... <mailto:pjack@...>> 
> wrote:
> 
>     >  Is there more specific documentation that helps out a more novice
>     >  developer like myself?
> 
>     There's the developer's guide:
>     http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/building.html#eclipse
>     <http://crawler.archive.org/articles/developer_manual/building.html#eclipse>
> 
>     >  Any help would be greatly appreciated,
> 
>     You'll need to copy the /lib directory jar files to a /lib directory in
>     your Eclipse project. Otherwise it sounds like you should be ready to
>     go. To run Heritrix in Eclipse, right-click the
>     org.archive.crawler.Heritrix class and select "Debug As/Java
>     Application."
> 
>     -Paul
